description: |-
  Validate that a list is not empty.
---

# function: non_empty_list

Returns true when the list contains at least one element. Raises an error when the list is empty.

## Example Usage

```terraform
terraform {
  required_providers {
    validatefx = {
      source  = "The-DevOps-Daily/validatefx"
      version = ">= 0.0.1"
    }
  }
}

provider "validatefx" {}

locals {
  # Example 1: Single element list
  list1  = ["item"]
  valid1 = provider::validatefx::non_empty_list(local.list1)

  # Example 2: Multiple elements
  list2  = ["apple", "banana", "cherry"]
  valid2 = provider::validatefx::non_empty_list(local.list2)

  # Example 3: Many elements
  list3  = ["one", "two", "three", "four", "five"]
  valid3 = provider::validatefx::non_empty_list(local.list3)
}

output "validation_results" {
  value = {
    list1_valid = local.valid1
    list2_valid = local.valid2
    list3_valid = local.valid3
  }
}
```

## Signature

<!-- signature generated by tfplugindocs -->
```text
non_empty_list(values list of string) bool
```

## Arguments

<!-- arguments generated by tfplugindocs -->
1. `values` (List of String, Nullable) List to validate.
